author: jih2nn
content: If I understood you correctly, FOCIL doesn't have this capability and I'm not sure if this is within the FOCIL's scope. In FOCIL, when `engine_newPayload` is called, the EL checks if all valid IL transactions are included in the payload, but not beyond that; it doesn't check if the given payload is censoring based on whichever algorithm they use. IMO, adding that boolean implies quite a semantic change to FOCIL. I'd like to see rough consensus on that modification before making the change.

author: jih2nn
content: It returns `INCLUSION_LIST_UNSATISFIED` status when the payload is not IL complaint. See the spec here: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/609/files#diff-56179c5619aa2eb24d80091034dc29303bcf819ca721d84710a6809d9508a8a9R87

author: jih2nn
content: It only checks if the given payload is IL compliant. It doesn't check if it's a censoring payload based on some algorithm, which is a different story.
